blocks.text: The Xiegu G90 is an amateur radio portable 20W HF transceiver using 24-bit SDR technology. Based on a 24bit-CODEC, the G90 brings superior transceiver performance and a highly configurable user experience. The detachable head design allows flexibility in positioning the radio's main body.

To start the transceiver, press the power button for a short period. To shut down, press and hold the power button for 1 second. While powered on, a quick press of the power button turns off the LCD screen to save electricity - the radio continues to work normally.

Press the MODE button to cycle through transmission modes: LSB - L-D - USB - U-D - CW - CWR - NFM - AM. The two data modes (L-D and U-D) automatically route audio through the ACC port and mute the microphone for digital operation.
The BAND buttons cycle through amateur bands. System menu option 8 controls whether shortwave broadcast bands are included in the rotation - transmission is only allowed on amateur bands.

As a Software Defined Radio, features can change with firmware updates. Ensure your G90 is at the latest firmware level. If instructions don't work as expected, you may be on a different firmware version.
Hold the FUNC button for 1-2 seconds to enter the system menu. Use PREV/NEXT to navigate pages, the main tuning dial to change values, and SAVE to confirm changes or EXIT to discard.

blocks.name: Handle up/down
blocks.description: Customize the hand microphone up/down buttons. Options: FREQCH+/- (frequency/channel), BAND+/-, VOLUM+/-. Default: FREQCH+/-

blocks.name: Handle F1/F2
blocks.description: Customize hand microphone F1 and F2 button functions. Options: PRE/ATT, SPLT, NB, COMP, AGC. Defaults: F1=PRE/ATT, F2=SPLT

blocks.name: LCD BL
blocks.description: Set display backlight brightness from 10% to 100%. Default: 80%

blocks.name: AUX IN/OUT Volum
blocks.description: Set ACC port audio input/output levels (0-15). Used for digital mode audio routing. Defaults: IN=8, OUT=15

blocks.name: RCLK Tune
blocks.description: Adjust the internal frequency reference (-1000Hz to +1000Hz). If showing a consistent frequency offset, adjust here to recalibrate. Default: 0Hz

blocks.name: Band Stack Mode
blocks.description: Include or exclude shortwave broadcast bands when cycling with band buttons. Options: HAM Band (amateur only), FULL Band (amateur + broadcast). Default: HAM Band

blocks.text: The KEY interface is a 3.5mm stereo jack for manual or paddle keys. If using a 6.5mm 2-wire plug, change it to a 3-wire 3.5mm stereo plug with both key contacts going to the appropriate terminals.

blocks.name: SPEED
blocks.description: Set automatic keyer rate. Access via FUNC + KEY button, adjust with main tuning knob.

blocks.name: CW Volume
blocks.description: Set sidetone volume. Access via FUNC + KEY button (second function).

blocks.name: CW TONE
blocks.description: Set sidetone frequency. Long press the M/L/R button to access.

blocks.name: QSK
blocks.description: Toggle full break-in (QSK) on/off. When enabled, you can hear between transmitted elements.

blocks.name: MODE (Iambic)
blocks.description: Switch between Iambic A and Iambic B keyer modes.

blocks.text: Direct use of 2-core to 3-core adapters or incorrect wiring may put the radio into CW transmission mode permanently.
The G90 has a built-in variable digital filter with continuously adjustable bandwidth. Firmware v1.79b02 introduced a 2-BPF mode allowing two preset filters per mode that can be quickly switched.
Short press the MFK button to switch between BPF1/BPF2 (color changes slightly). Turn the MFK encoder to adjust the selected filter. Long press MFK or FUNC to exit.
In CW mode, the digital filter can be made as narrow as 50Hz, but there will be obvious deterioration of audio at such extreme settings. 300-500 Hz is normally ideal.

The G90 operates from 10.5-16.5V DC with negative ground. Current capability of the DC power supply should be at least 8 amps. The transmitter is designed so that dropping supply voltage from a weak battery has little effect on output power until 10.5V is reached.

Connect the red wire to positive and black wire to negative. A ferrite choke on the power wires (closest to the radio) helps prevent RF interference. Although the G90 has reverse polarity protection, reverse connection should be avoided.
Operation above the maximum voltage (16.5V) will seriously damage the radio! The warranty does not cover damage caused by incorrect power connection or improper voltage.
The G90 has a built-in wide-range automatic antenna tuner capable of matching a very wide range of antennas.

Press TUNE momentarily to bring the ATU in-circuit (antenna icon appears). To initiate tuning, hold TUNE for >2 seconds - 'Tuning' will be displayed. After tuning completes, leave the ATU ON to provide the antenna match during operation.

The SWR scanner (long press POW) scans the connected antenna's SWR across frequencies. Press the button below BW to change scan step, FAST/SLOW for scan speed, and QUIT to exit. The bottom of the screen shows the frequency of lowest SWR (antenna resonance).
If the SWR icon flashes while transmitting even after tuning, the antenna SWR is too high. Another tuning attempt may help, but this could also indicate a faulty antenna.

blocks.name: Radio won't power on
blocks.description: Check DC power connections and polarity. Verify supply voltage is 10.5-16.5V. Try a different power source.

blocks.name: No audio output
blocks.description: Check if in headphone mode (speaker icon). Press volume knob to toggle. Verify volume is turned up.

blocks.name: Can't transmit
blocks.description: Verify you're on an amateur band (not broadcast). Check that PTT or key is properly connected. Ensure SWR is acceptable.

blocks.name: Digital modes not working
blocks.description: Use U-D or L-D mode (not USB/LSB). Check AUX IN/OUT volume settings in system menu. Verify ACC port audio connections.

blocks.name: Frequency display seems off
blocks.description: Use RCLK Tune in system menu to calibrate the reference oscillator if you notice a consistent offset.

blocks.text: Do not insert the USB-serial cable into the COMM socket before powering on the G90 - this may trigger firmware update mode and require a firmware reinstall.
